channel.title: Continue this on! - .java Class
channel.description:
I think that this would be a little fun activity. Let's continue on this class.
[code=java] public class Continue { [/code]
Everyone has to continue on from where the other person left.
So, if someone does,
[code=java] public class Continue {
if(player.soulsplit) { addHP(1*killerz.HP) { [/code]
Then someone must continue this on.
Looking forward for some goodness.
If someone tries to act funny and ends the class, delete the brackets they added and continue on.

item.title: Continue this on! - .java Class
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:9, topic:440072”]public class continue {
public void Continue() {
Continue();
}
}[/quote]

Hoho, I see what you did there.

public class Continue {
	public void Continue() {
		String continue = "
		public class Continue {
		    public void Continue() {
		    	Continue();
		    }
		}
		";
		Pattern pattern = Pattern.compile("public void [^ ]+");
                Matcher matcher = pattern.match(continue);
                // Someone make an interpreter for this because I'm fucking lazy
	}
}

Read full topic

item.title: Continue this on! - .java Class
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

A nice antileech (yet simple as fuck) that confuses people. I put it in any servers I release the source of.

public class antiLoop {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        loop();
    }

    public void loop() {
        while(true) {
        }
    }
}

Edit: Or even mindfuck them and put a ‘System.exit(1);’ called somewhere in the events.

Read full topic
